item.title: Despite NSA Claim, Election Vendor Denies System Was Compromised In Hack Attempt
item.description: June 20, 2017 - "Even though NSA says it's likely that we opened them, we did not," VR Systems COO Ben Martin says of emails that came into the company's system.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 20, 2017 - "Even though NSA says it's likely that we opened them, we did not," VR Systems COO Ben Martin says of emails that came into the company's system. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/20/533637643/despite-nsa-claim-election-vendor-denies-system-was-compromised-in-hack-attempt

item.title: Why You Should Play Video Games
item.description: June 20, 2017 - We live in a world of endless pressing concerns with so many competing avenues of being productive. A good game makes no demands: All that matters is the enjoyment of the doing, says Adam Frank.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 20, 2017 - We live in a world of endless pressing concerns with so many competing avenues of being productive. A good game makes no demands: All that matters is the enjoyment of the doing, says Adam Frank. http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/06/20/533617105/why-you-should-play-video-games

item.title: Firm Contracted By Republican Groups Left Millions Of Voter Files Unsecured Online
item.description: June 19, 2017 - A security researcher discovered massive troves of information about 198 million potential American voters stored on an Amazon server without as much as a password.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 19, 2017 - A security researcher discovered massive troves of information about 198 million potential American voters stored on an Amazon server without as much as a password. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/19/533551243/firm-contracted-by-rnc-left-millions-of-voter-files-unsecured-online

item.title: Online Retail Boom Means More Warehouse Workers, And Robots To Accompany Them
item.description: June 19, 2017 - On the outskirts of the Bay Area, farming communities are hoping that warehouse jobs tied to the e-commerce surge will boost the local economy. But automation is expected to take over many such jobs.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 19, 2017 - On the outskirts of the Bay Area, farming communities are hoping that warehouse jobs tied to the e-commerce surge will boost the local economy. But automation is expected to take over many such jobs. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/06/19/533506913/online-retail-boom-means-more-warehouse-workers-and-robots-to-accompany-them

item.title: Wal-Mart To Buy Bonobos In Challenge To Amazon
item.description:
June 18, 2017 - Wal-Mart is purchasing men's clothing seller Bonobos as the giant retailer looks to stay competitive with Amazon.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/06/18/533402821/wal-mart-to-buy-bonobos-in-challenge-to-amazon
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Amazon Announces Plan To Buy Whole Foods For $13.7 Billion
item.description: June 16, 2017 - Amazon announced it will buy Whole Foods Market in a deal valued at $13.7 billion. This is by far the largest acquisition Amazon has made, promising a massive change of pace for both the organic food chain and its competitors.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 16, 2017 - Amazon announced it will buy Whole Foods Market in a deal valued at $13.7 billion. This is by far the largest acquisition Amazon has made, promising a massive change of pace for both the organic food chain and its competitors. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/16/533255561/amazon-announces-plan-to-buy-whole-foods-for-13-7-billion

item.title: Is The Concern Artificial Intelligence — Or Autonomy?
item.description: June 16, 2017 - At the end of the day, even the smartest computers are tools, our tools, and their intentions are our intentions — to the extent that we can speak of their intentions at all, says blogger Alva Noë.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 16, 2017 - At the end of the day, even the smartest computers are tools, our tools, and their intentions are our intentions — to the extent that we can speak of their intentions at all, says blogger Alva Noë. http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/06/16/533196904/is-the-concern-artificial-intelligence-or-autonomy

item.title: Amazon Says It Will Buy Whole Foods In $13.7 Billion Deal
item.description: June 16, 2017 - Whole Foods, which opened its first store in Austin, Texas, back in 1980, now has 465 markets in North America and the U.K.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 16, 2017 - Whole Foods, which opened its first store in Austin, Texas, back in 1980, now has 465 markets in North America and the U.K. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/16/533199862/amazon-says-it-will-buy-whole-foods-in-13-7-billion-deal

item.title: Investing In Bitcoin: A Wise Choice?
item.description: June 16, 2017 - The price of bitcoin has been soaring, leading some amateur investors to jump into the virtual currency market. But even enthusiasts are worried the price surge might be a bubble about to burst.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 16, 2017 - The price of bitcoin has been soaring, leading some amateur investors to jump into the virtual currency market. But even enthusiasts are worried the price surge might be a bubble about to burst. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/16/533176648/investing-in-bitcoin-a-wise-choice

item.title: WATCH: What Makes Japan No. 1 In Toilet Technology
item.description: June 16, 2017 - In NPR's Elise Tries series, correspondent Elise Hu tries out new experiences in East Asia. In this episode, Japanese toilets: so automated and comfortable, you might never want to leave the bathroom.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 16, 2017 - In NPR's Elise Tries series, correspondent Elise Hu tries out new experiences in East Asia. In this episode, Japanese toilets: so automated and comfortable, you might never want to leave the bathroom. http://www.npr.org/sections/parallels/2017/06/16/526005547/watch-what-makes-japan-no-1-in-toilet-technology

item.title: The Investor Who Took On Uber, And Silicon Valley
item.description: June 15, 2017 - In Silicon Valley, you're supposed to build businesses unapologetically. You're not supposed to speak out against injustice. Freada Kapor Klein breaks those rules.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 15, 2017 - In Silicon Valley, you're supposed to build businesses unapologetically. You're not supposed to speak out against injustice. Freada Kapor Klein breaks those rules. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/06/15/532973451/the-investor-who-took-on-uber-and-silicon-valley

item.title: Podcasts And Audiobooks Reach Out To A New Audience: Children
item.description: June 15, 2017 - There are so many entertainment offerings for children and their parents, it can be hard to choose. We look at podcasts and audiobooks for children.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 15, 2017 - There are so many entertainment offerings for children and their parents, it can be hard to choose. We look at podcasts and audiobooks for children. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/15/533023825/podcasts-and-audiobooks-reach-out-to-a-new-audience-children

item.title: Meet Binky, The Social Media App Where Nothing Matters
item.description: June 14, 2017 - A new social media app lets you think that you're liking, commenting and sharing an infinite list of random posts. But "it's all meaningless," Binky creator Dan Kurtz says. And that's the point.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 14, 2017 - A new social media app lets you think that you're liking, commenting and sharing an infinite list of random posts. But "it's all meaningless," Binky creator Dan Kurtz says. And that's the point. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/06/14/532879727/meet-binky-the-social-media-app-where-nothing-matters

item.title: If Voting Machines Were Hacked, Would Anyone Know?
item.description: June 14, 2017 - Even if most voting machines aren't connected to the Internet, "they are connected to something that's connected to something that's connected to the Internet," says one cybersecurity expert.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 14, 2017 - Even if most voting machines aren't connected to the Internet, "they are connected to something that's connected to something that's connected to the Internet," says one cybersecurity expert. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/14/532824432/if-voting-machines-were-hacked-would-anyone-know

item.title: Why Hasn't Online Dating Made It Onscreen?
item.description: June 14, 2017 - The technology around us has made its way into all kinds of movies — sci-fi, thrillers, horror. But there's one movie genre it hasn't been able to infiltrate — the romantic comedy.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 14, 2017 - The technology around us has made its way into all kinds of movies — sci-fi, thrillers, horror. But there's one movie genre it hasn't been able to infiltrate — the romantic comedy. http://www.npr.org/sections/monkeysee/2017/06/14/532752841/why-hasnt-online-dating-made-it-onscreen
